title: HTML Intro
description: Comprehensive introduction to HTML and web development for beginners. It covers the basics of HTML, as well as building a website project.
softwareRequired: Any text editor (e.g., Sublime Text, Visual Studio Code)
note: This is a suggested curriculum and can be adjusted based on your specific needs and learning style.

modules.title: Module 1: Introduction to HTML and Web Development

sessions.title: Session 1: What is HTML? Why learn it? Web development basics.
sessions.theory: History of HTML, web development ecosystem, basic website structure.
sessions.video: Introduction to HTML and its role in web development.
sessions.quiz: Multiple-choice questions on basic HTML concepts.
sessions.codingTask: Create a simple HTML document with basic tags and structure.

sessions.title: Session 2: Understanding HTML Syntax and Basic Tags.
sessions.video: Explanation of HTML syntax and common tags (e.g., heading, paragraph, image).
sessions.quiz: Matching and identification of HTML elements and attributes.
sessions.codingTask: Build a basic webpage with headings, paragraphs, and images.

sessions.title: Session 3: Formatting Text and Links.
sessions.theory: Inline and block elements, formatting tags (e.g., bold, italic, underline), linking pages with anchor tags.
sessions.video: Demonstration of text formatting and creating links in HTML.
sessions.quiz: True/False statements about text formatting and linking practices.
sessions.codingTask: Format text and create links on a webpage with different styles.

modules.title: Module 2: Building Website Structure with Semantic HTML

sessions.title: Session 1: Introduction to Semantic HTML and its Benefits.
sessions.theory: Importance of semantic HTML, common semantic tags (e.g., header, nav, main, section).
sessions.video: Explanation of semantic HTML and its impact on accessibility and SEO.
sessions.quiz: Identifying the correct semantic tag for different website elements.
sessions.codingTask: Rewrite a basic webpage using semantic HTML tags.

sessions.title: Session 2: Lists, Tables, and Forms.
sessions.theory: Creating ordered and unordered lists, table structure, basic form elements (e.g., input, textarea, button).
sessions.video: Demonstration of creating lists, tables, and forms with HTML.
sessions.quiz: Choosing the appropriate HTML tags for list items, table cells, and form fields.
sessions.codingTask: Build a webpage with a list, a table, and a simple form.

sessions.title: Session 3: Embedding Multimedia and Comments.
sessions.theory: Including images, videos, and audio using HTML tags, adding comments for clarity.
sessions.video: Explanation of multimedia embedding and commenting practices in HTML.
sessions.quiz: Identifying the correct HTML tags for different multimedia elements and comments.
sessions.codingTask: Add images, videos, or audio to a webpage and include comments for better code understanding.

modules.title: Module 3: Introducing CSS and Styling Techniques

sessions.title: Session 1: What is CSS and its Relationship with HTML?
sessions.theory: Introduction to CSS, linking CSS to HTML, external and internal stylesheets.
sessions.video: Explanation of CSS and its role in styling HTML elements.
sessions.quiz: Matching HTML elements with their corresponding CSS properties.
sessions.codingTask: Create a basic CSS stylesheet and link it to an HTML document to style the elements.

sessions.title: Session 2: Basic CSS Selectors and Properties.
sessions.theory: Different types of CSS selectors (e.g., ID, class, element), common CSS properties (e.g., color, font, background).
sessions.video: Demonstration of using various CSS selectors and properties to style elements.
sessions.quiz: Choosing the correct CSS selector to target specific elements on a webpage.
sessions.codingTask: Style various elements on a webpage using CSS selectors and properties.

sessions.title: Session 3: Intro to Layout and Responsive Design.
sessions.theory: Basic layout concepts (e.g., floats, positioning), importance of responsive design.
sessions.video: Explanation of layout techniques and introducing responsive design principles.
sessions.quiz: Identifying layout issues and suggesting responsive design solutions.
sessions.codingTask: Implement basic layout techniques and test the webpage on different screen sizes.

modules.title: Module 4: Advanced HTML and Form Validation

sessions.title: Session 1: Working with Hyperlinks and Navigation.
sessions.theory: Different types of links (e.g., absolute, relative), creating navigation menus using HTML.
sessions.video: Demonstration of creating various types of links and building navigation menus.

sessions.title: Session 2: Creating Interactive Forms with Advanced Elements.
sessions.theory: Input types (e.g., radio, checkbox, date, email), labels, form validation basics.
sessions.video: Demonstration of using advanced form elements and implementing basic validation.
sessions.quiz: Choosing the appropriate input type based on form requirements.
sessions.codingTask: Create a form with different input types and implement client-side validation.

sessions.title: Session 3: Intro to JavaScript for Dynamic Interactions.
sessions.theory: Understanding JavaScript and its role in enhancing HTML, adding events and interactivity.
sessions.video: Introduction to JavaScript and showcasing basic interactions (e.g., button clicks, form submissions).
sessions.quiz: Identifying basic JavaScript syntax and commands.
sessions.codingTask: Add simple JavaScript interactions to an existing webpage (e.g., pop-up message, form validation check).

modules.title: Module 5: Project: Building a Complete Website

sessions.title: Session 1: Planning and Designing Your Website.
sessions.theory: Identifying project goals, creating website mockups and wireframes.
sessions.video: Demonstration of website planning and design process.
sessions.quiz: Evaluating different website designs based on usability and accessibility principles.
sessions.task: Create a mockup or wireframe for your final website project.

sessions.title: Session 2: Implementing Website Structure and Styling with HTML and CSS.
sessions.theory: Putting it all together - using advanced HTML and CSS techniques for a complete website.
sessions.video: Building a website using learned HTML and CSS skills, incorporating best practices.
sessions.quiz: Choosing the appropriate HTML and CSS solutions for specific website elements and design goals.
sessions.task: Develop the HTML and CSS structure for your website project based on the mockup/wireframe.

sessions.title: Session 3: Adding Interactivity and Finishing Touches with JavaScript.
sessions.theory: Implementing advanced JavaScript features and libraries for enhanced interactivity (e.g., animations, data manipulation).
sessions.video: Adding JavaScript functionalities to a website, showcasing practical examples.
sessions.quiz: Identifying the potential use of JavaScript libraries for specific website features.
sessions.task: Integrate JavaScript into your project to add interactivity and desired functionalities.

sessions.title: Session 4: Deploying Your Website and Final Review.
sessions.theory: Different hosting options, uploading website files, basic SEO considerations.
sessions.video: Demonstrating website deployment process and essential SEO practices.
sessions.quiz: Identifying key factors for successful website deployment and maintenance.
sessions.task: Deploy your website project to a chosen platform and perform a final review for functionality and optimization.
